answers.answer: Hello,You are in your second trimester and you should start gaining weight. Sometimes a sudden drop in fluid retention can cause weight loss in your second trimester. If you were overweight at the time you conceived, you are not expected to gain as much in your second trimester as a woman who started her pregnancy at a healthy weight. Inadequate weight gain can lead to intrauterine growth retardation. If there is still no weight gain it can be a signal for preeclampsia, or pregnancy-induced hypertension. Other causes can include a lack of amniotic fluid or gestational diabetes. Ensure sufficient intake of proteins and vitamins. It is suggested to get examined by your gynecologist and get evaluated. I hope it helps.Take care and regards!
If you like Peanut butter, start with that. Peanut butter sandwich, shakes, it gives you protein and it's fattening but in a good way. It's not just empty calories.

You are under the care of an OB-GYN, aren't you? If not, make an appointment. Now. If he/she is concerned, they will advise you, but listen to a DOCTOR for the sake of your child and your own health....as the doctor above advised.

question: I am a 22 year old female i am 14 weeks pregnant and I'm still losing weight i can't seem to start gaining the weight i need anyone have any ideas what i could do
title: cant gain weight
